comments:
M5 candidate I20070222-1906

I tried creating an FTP connection by expanding the FTP system type in the system view. The wizard comes up, but I get an NPE when attempting to move off the first page of the wizard. I was able to create at least one connection this way, so it may only be subsequent connections. The stack trace follows:

I recommend a lower priority since this would probably not be used by most folks. Indeed, you have to change a preference to enable this.

Ok. I've fixed (but not committed) the original problem here. But after that another very ugly problem had been revealed. The SubSystemServiceWizardPage is messing up the page container control unrecoverable if the wizard dialog is invoked from the new connection prompt in the remote systems view. The page is doing well if the new connection wizard is invoked from the toolbar or the context menu of an existing connection. As the whole SubSystemServiceWizardPage is the original implementation, it seems unlikely that it should have worked in RSE1.0.1.
Problem found and fixed. Waiting for repository to re-open for commits ...

The bug appears fixed, but I used to be able to create connections by "expanding" the system type. Now I have to bring up the context menu as there is no expansion available. I can't recall when the create by expansion behavior disappeared. Is this disappearance peculiar to the Macintosh or is it on all platforms?

The create connection on expand had been removed quite a while ago. That had been shortly after M5 if I'm not mistaken.

The problem with that "feature" had been that it invoked the new connection wizard unwanted on a events (can't really remember anymore if it had been refresh, delete connection or something else). Only way to get stopping the wizard from being invoked had been to clean up the implementation and let the system type be a "normal" node without children. 

Shortest way to invoke the wizard ... click on the new connection icon in the toolbar.
